problems.problem: Define aldehydes and give the general formula.

step_by_step.explanation: Aldehydes are organic compounds containing a carbonyl group (C=O) bonded to at least one hydrogen atom.

problems.final_answer: Aldehydes: C=O bonded to H and R group; general formula R-CHO

problems.problem: Define ketones and give the general formula.

step_by_step.explanation: Ketones are organic compounds containing a carbonyl group (C=O) bonded to two carbon atoms.

problems.final_answer: Ketones: C=O bonded to two carbons; general formula R-CO-R'

problems.problem: Give the IUPAC name of CH3CHO.

step_by_step.explanation: CHO group is aldehyde, attached to one carbon → ethanal

problems.problem: Give the IUPAC name of CH3COCH3.

step_by_step.explanation: CO group is ketone, attached to two carbons → propanone
Aldehydes are oxidized to carboxylic acids using oxidizing agents like Tollens' reagent or KMnO4.

problems.problem: Explain why ketones are resistant to mild oxidation.

step_by_step.explanation: Ketones have the carbonyl carbon bonded to two carbons; no hydrogen available for mild oxidation, so they resist oxidation.

problems.final_answer: Ketones resist mild oxidation due to lack of H on carbonyl carbon.

problems.problem: Predict the product of CH3CHO + [O] (mild oxidizing agent).
Explain the nucleophilic addition reaction of aldehydes with HCN.

step_by_step.explanation: Cyanide ion attacks the carbonyl carbon, forming a cyanohydrin.

problems.problem: Distinguish between aldehydes and ketones using Tollens' test.

step_by_step.explanation: Gives silver mirror with Tollens' reagent.
No reaction with Tollens' reagent under same conditions.

problems.final_answer: Aldehyde → silver mirror; Ketone → no reaction

problems.problem: Explain the difference in reactivity between aldehydes and ketones toward nucleophiles.

step_by_step.explanation: More reactive due to less steric hindrance and more electrophilic carbonyl carbon.
Less reactive due to steric hindrance and electron-donating alkyl groups stabilizing the carbonyl carbon.

problems.final_answer: Aldehydes more reactive than ketones toward nucleophiles.
